alert.note: Alert for Cimarron (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 3:36AM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Cimarron County through 400 AM CDT... At 335 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles north of Keyes, or 18 miles west of Elkhart, moving south at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Boise City, Keyes, Griggs and Sturgis. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 AM CDT for the Panhandle of Oklahoma.
